35t.defHTML: A prototype cryostat and SP detector built at Fermilab before the ProtoDUNE detectors.
35t.defLaTeX: A prototype cryostat and \gls{sp} detector built at \gls{fnal} before the \gls{protodune} detectors

3dst.defHTML: The core part of the \threed projection scintillator tracker spectrometer in the near detector conceptual design.
3dst.defLaTeX: The core part of the \threed projection scintillator tracker spectrometer in the near detector conceptual design

3dsts.defHTML: The \threed projection scintillator tracker spectrometer in the near detector conceptual design.
3dsts.defLaTeX: The \threed projection scintillator tracker spectrometer  in the near detector conceptual design

4850l.defHTML: The depth in feet (1480 m) of the top of the cryostats underground at SURF; used more generally to refer to the DUNE underground area. Called the ``4850 level'' or ``4850L''.
4850l.defLaTeX: The depth in feet (1480 m) of the top of the cryostats underground at SURF; used more generally to refer to the DUNE underground area. Called the ``4850 level'' or ``4850L''

adc.defHTML: A sampling of a voltage resulting in a discrete integer count corresponding in some way to the input.
adc.defLaTeX: A sampling of a voltage  resulting in a discrete integer count corresponding in some way to  the input

ahj.defHTML: An organization, office, or individual responsible for enforcing the requirements of a code or standard, or for approving equipment, materials, an installation, or a procedure (OSHA).
ahj.defLaTeX: An organization, office, or individual responsible for enforcing the requirements of a code or standard, or for approving equipment, materials, an installation, or a procedure (\gls{osha})

alara.defHTML: Typically used with regard management of radiation exposure but may be used more generally. It means making every reasonable effort to maintain e.g., exposures, to as far below the limits as practical, consistent with the purpose for that the activity is undertaken.
alara.defLaTeX: Typically used with regard management of radiation  exposure but may be used more generally. It means making every  reasonable effort to maintain e.g., exposures, to as far below the  limits as practical, consistent with the purpose for that the  activity is undertaken

alice.defHTML: A Large Ion Collider Experiment, at CERN.
alice.defLaTeX: A Large Ion Collider Experiment, at CERN

amc.defHTML: Holds digitizing electronics and lives in $\mu$TCA crates.
amc.defLaTeX: Holds digitizing  electronics and lives in \gls{utca} crates

ams.defHTML: Verilog-AMS is a derivative of the Verilog hardware description language that includes analog and mixed-signal extensions (AMS) in order to define the behavior of analog and mixed-signal systems.
ams.defLaTeX: Verilog-AMS is a derivative of the Verilog hardware description language that includes analog and mixed-signal extensions (AMS) in order to define the behavior of analog and mixed-signal systems

anl.defHTML: US national laboratory in Lemont, IL.
anl.defLaTeX: US national laboratory in Lemont, IL

apa.defHTML: A unit of the SP detector module containing the elements sensitive to ionization in the LAr. It contains two faces each of three planes of wires, and interfaces to the cold electronics and photon detection system.
apa.defLaTeX: A unit of the \gls{sp}  detector module containing the elements sensitive to ionization in the \gls{lar}.  It contains two faces each of three planes of wires, and interfaces to the cold  electronics and photon detection system

arapuca.defHTML: A PD system design that consists of a light trap that captures wavelength-shifted photons inside boxes with highly reflective internal surfaces until they are eventually detected by SiPM detectors or are lost.
arapuca.defLaTeX: A \gls{pds} design that consists of a light trap that captures wavelength-shifted photons inside boxes with highly reflective internal surfaces until they are eventually detected by \gls{sipm} detectors or are lost

arcube.defHTML: The name of the core part of the DUNE ND, a LArTPC.
arcube.defLaTeX: The name of the core part of the \gls{dune} \gls{nd}, a \gls{lartpc}

argoneut.defHTML: The ArgoNeuT test-beam experiment and LArTPC prototype at Fermilab.
argoneut.defLaTeX: The ArgoNeuT test-beam experiment and \gls{lartpc} prototype at  \gls{fnal}

art.defHTML: A software framework implementing an event-based execution paradigm.
art.defLaTeX: A software framework implementing an  event-based execution paradigm

artdaq.defHTML: A data acquisition toolkit for data transfer, aggregation and processing.
artdaq.defLaTeX: A data acquisition toolkit for data transfer, aggregation and processing

ashriver.defHTML: The Ash River, Minnesota, USA NOvA experiment far site, used as an assembly test site for DUNE.
ashriver.defLaTeX: The Ash River, Minnesota, USA \gls{nova} experiment far site, used as an assembly test site for \gls{dune}

atca.defHTML: An advanced computer architecture specification developed for the telecommunications, military, and aerospace industries that incorporates the latest trends in high-speed interconnect technologies, next-generation processors, and improved reliability, availability and serviceability.
atca.defLaTeX: An advanced computer architecture specification developed for the telecommunications, military, and aerospace industries that incorporates the latest trends in  high-speed interconnect technologies, next-generation processors, and improved reliability, availability and serviceability

atlas.defHTML: One of two general-purpose detectors at the LHC. It investigates a wide range of physics, from the search for the Higgs boson to extra dimensions and particles that could make up DM.
atlas.defLaTeX: One of two general-purpose detectors at the \gls{lhc}. It investigates a wide range of physics, from the search for the Higgs boson to extra dimensions and particles that could make up \gls{dm}

aup.defHTML: Required for beneficial occupancy of the underground areas at SURF for LBNF and DUNE.
aup.defLaTeX: Required for beneficial occupancy of the underground areas at \gls{surf} for \gls{lbnf} and \gls{dune}

awg.defHTML: U.S. standard set of non-ferrous wire conductor sizes.
awg.defLaTeX: U.S. standard set of non-ferrous wire conductor sizes

baryonnumber.defHTML: A quantity expressing the total number of baryons in a system minus the number of antibaryons.
baryonnumber.defLaTeX: A quantity expressing the total number of baryons in a system minus the number of antibaryons

bdm.defHTML: A new model that describes a relativistic dark matter particle boosted by the annihilation of heavier dark matter particles in the galactic center or the sun.
bdm.defLaTeX: A new model that describes a relativistic dark matter particle boosted by the annihilation of heavier dark matter particles in the galactic center or the sun

beamline.defLaTeX: A sequence of control and monitoring devices used for the formation of a directed collection of particles

belleii.defHTML: B-factory experiment now running at KEK.
belleii.defLaTeX: B-factory experiment now running at KEK

bms.defHTML: Part of the safety system at SURF that includes the fire and life safety system.
bms.defLaTeX: Part of the safety system at \gls{surf} that includes the fire and life safety system

bnl.defHTML: US national laboratory in Upton, NY.
bnl.defLaTeX: US national laboratory in Upton, NY

bnv.defHTML: Describing an interaction where baryon number is not conserved.
bnv.defLaTeX: Describing an interaction where \gls{baryonnumber} is not conserved

botfc.defHTML: The horizontal portions of the SP FC on the bottom of the TPC.
botfc.defLaTeX: The horizontal portions of the \gls{sp} \gls{fc} on the bottom of the \gls{tpc}

bow.defHTML: A working name for the front-end readout computing elements used in the nominal DAQ design to interface the DP crates to the DAQ front-end computers.
bow.defLaTeX: A working name for the front-end readout computing elements used in the nominal \gls{daq} design to interface the \gls{dp}  crates to the \gls{daq} front-end computers

br.defHTML: A fractional probability for a decay of a composite particle to occur into some specified set or sets of products.
br.defLaTeX: A fractional probability for a  decay of a composite particle to occur into some specified set or  sets of products

bsi.defHTML: The work package for outfitting of the LBNF underground infrastructure.
bsi.defLaTeX: The work package for outfitting of the \gls{lbnf} underground infrastructure

bugey.defLaTeX: Neutrino experiment that operated at the Bugey nuclear power plant in France

cabangle.defHTML: A quark mixing parameter that governs the coupling of up quarks to strange quarks.
cabangle.defLaTeX: A quark mixing parameter that governs the coupling of up quarks to strange quarks

captain.defHTML: Experimental program sited at LANL that is designed to make measurements of scientific importance to LBL neutrino physics and physics topics that will be explored by large underground detectors.
captain.defLaTeX: Experimental program sited at \gls{lanl} that is designed to make measurements of scientific importance to \gls{lbl} neutrino physics and physics topics that will be explored by large underground detectors

catiroc.defLaTeX: A complete read-out chip manufactured in AustriaMicroSystem designed to read arrays of 16 photomultipliers
catiroc.term: charge and time integrated readout chip

cc.defHTML: Refers to an interaction between elementary particles where a charged weak force carrier ($W^+$ or $W^-$) is exchanged.
cc.defLaTeX: Refers to an interaction  between elementary particles where a charged weak force carrier  ($W^+$ or $W^-$) is exchanged

cdr.defHTML: A formal project document  that describes the experiment at a conceptual level.
cdr.defLaTeX: A formal project  document   that describes the experiment  at a conceptual level

cdrev.defHTML: A project management device by which a conceptual design is reviewed.
cdrev.defLaTeX: A project management device by which a conceptual design is reviewed

ce.defLaTeX: Analog and digital readout electronics that operate at cryogenic temperatures

cern.defHTML: The leading particle physics laboratory in Europe and home to the ProtoDUNEs. (In French, the Organisation Europ\'{e}enne pour la Recherche Nucl\'{e}aire, derived from Conseil Europ\'{e}en pour la Recherche Nucl\'{e}aire).
cern.defLaTeX: The leading particle physics laboratory in Europe and home to the ProtoDUNEs. (In French, the Organisation Europ\'{e}enne pour la Recherche Nucl\'{e}aire, derived from Conseil Europ\'{e}en pour la Recherche Nucl\'{e}aire)

cf.defHTML: Pertaining to construction and operation of buildings and conventional infrastructure, and for LBNF/DUNE, CF includes the excavation caverns.
cf.defLaTeX: Pertaining to  construction and operation of buildings and conventional infrastructure, and for \gls{lbnf-dune}, CF includes the excavation caverns

cfd.defHTML: High performance computer-assisted modeling of fluid dynamical systems.
cfd.defLaTeX: High performance computer-assisted modeling of fluid dynamical systems

cisc.defHTML: Includes equipment to monitor all detector components and LAr quality and behavior, and provides a control system for many of the detector components.
cisc.defLaTeX: Includes equipment to monitor all detector  components and  \gls{lar} quality and behavior, and provides a control system for many of the detector components

citf.defHTML: A facility at Fermilab with small ($<\,\SI{1}{ton}$) to intermediate ($\sim\,\SI{1}{ton}$) volumes of instrumented, purified TPC-grade LAr, used for testing devices intended for use in DUNE.
citf.defLaTeX: A facility at \gls{fnal} with small ($<\,\SI{1}{ton}$) to intermediate ($\sim\,\SI{1}{ton}$) volumes of instrumented, purified TPC-grade \gls{lar}, used for testing devices intended for use in \gls{dune}

ckm.defHTML: Refers to the matrix describing the mixing between mass and weak eigenstates of quarks.
ckm.defLaTeX: Refers to the matrix describing the mixing between mass and  weak eigenstates of quarks

cl.defHTML: Refers to a probability used to determine the value of a random variable given its distribution.
cl.defLaTeX: Refers to a probability  used to determine the value of a random variable given its  distribution

cmgc.defHTML: The organizational unit responsible for management of the construction of conventional facilities at the underground area at the SURF site.
cmgc.defLaTeX: The organizational unit responsible for management of the construction of conventional facilities at the underground area at the \gls{surf} site

cms.defHTML: Compact Muon Solenoid experiment at CERN.
cms.defLaTeX: Compact Muon Solenoid experiment at CERN

cnn.defHTML: A deep learning technique most commonly applied to analyzing visual imagery.
cnn.defLaTeX: A deep learning technique most commonly applied to analyzing visual imagery

cno.defHTML: The CNO cycle (for carbon-nitrogen-oxygen) is one of the two known sets of fusion reactions by which stars convert hydrogen to helium, the other being the proton-proton chain reaction (pp-chain reaction). In the CNO cycle, four protons fuse, using carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen isotopes as catalysts, to produce one alpha particle, two positrons and two electron neutrinos.
cno.defLaTeX: The CNO cycle (for carbon-nitrogen-oxygen) is one of the two known sets of fusion reactions by which stars convert hydrogen to helium, the other being the proton-proton chain reaction (pp-chain reaction). In the CNO cycle, four protons fuse, using carbon, nitrogen, and oxygen isotopes as catalysts, to produce one alpha particle, two positrons and two electron neutrinos

cob.defHTML: An ATCA motherboard housing four RCEs.
cob.defLaTeX: An ATCA motherboard housing four RCEs

coldadc.defHTML: A newly developed 16-channels ASIC providing analog to digital conversion.
coldadc.defLaTeX: A newly developed 16-channels \gls{asic} providing analog to digital conversion

comfund.defHTML: The shared resources of the collaboration.
comfund.defLaTeX: The shared resources of the collaboration

core.defHTML: CORE contributions are in either monetary units or labor hours. They can be technical components for the facility or experiment and the effort of the staff needed to produce, install, and test them; major facilities for the experiment; or other products and services relevant for the completion of the facility or experiment.
core.defLaTeX: CORE contributions are in either monetary units or labor hours. They can be technical components for the facility or experiment and the effort of the staff needed to produce, install, and test them;  major facilities for the experiment; or other products and services relevant for the completion of the facility or experiment

cots.defHTML: Items, typically hardware such ascomputers, that may be purchased whole, without any custom design or fabrication andthus at normal consumer prices and availability.
cots.defLaTeX: Items, typically hardware such ascomputers, that may be purchased whole, without any custom design or fabrication andthus at normal consumer prices and availability

cp.defHTML: Product of charge and parity transformations.
cp.defLaTeX: Product of charge and parity  transformations

cpa.defHTML: The component of the SP detector module that provides the drift HV cathode.
cpa.defLaTeX: The component of the \gls{sp} detector module that provides the drift HV cathode

cpafc.defHTML: A pair of CPA panels and the top and bottom FC portions that attach to the pair; an intermediate assembly for installation into the SP module.
cpafc.defLaTeX: A pair of \gls{cpa} panels and the top and bottom \gls{fc} portions that attach to the pair; an intermediate assembly for installation into the \gls{spmod}

cpt.defHTML: product of charge, parity and time-reversal transformations.
cpt.defLaTeX: product of charge, parity  and time-reversal transformations
cpt.term: charge, parity, and time reversal symmetry

cpv.defHTML: Lack of symmetry in a system before and after charge and parity transformations are applied. For CP symmetry to hold, a particle turns into its corresponding antiparticle under a charge transformation, and a paritytransformation inverts its space coordinates, i.e. produces the mirror image.
cpv.defLaTeX: Lack of  symmetry in a system before and after charge and parity  transformations are applied.  For CP symmetry to hold,  a particle turns into its corresponding antiparticle under a charge transformation, and a paritytransformation inverts its space coordinates, i.e. produces the mirror image

cro.defHTML: The system for detecting ionization charge distributions in a DP detector module.
cro.defLaTeX: The system for detecting  ionization charge distributions in a \gls{dp} detector module

crp.defHTML: In the DP technology, a collection of electrodes in a planar arrangement placed at a particular voltage relative to some applied \efield such that drifting electrons may be collected and their number and time may be measured.
crp.defLaTeX: In the \gls{dp} technology, a  collection of  electrodes in a planar arrangement placed at a particular voltage  relative to some applied \efield such that drifting electrons  may be collected and their number and time may be measured

crt.defHTML: Detector external to the TPC designed to tag TPC-traversing cosmic ray particles.
crt.defLaTeX: Detector external to the TPC designed to tag TPC-traversing cosmic ray particles

cryo.defHTML: Integrated ASIC including FE circuitry providing signal amplification and pulse shaping, analog to digital conversion, and control and communication functionalities for 64 channels.
cryo.defLaTeX: Integrated ASIC including \gls{fe} circuitry providing signal amplification and pulse shaping, analog to digital conversion, and control and communication functionalities for 64 channels

ctsf.defHTML: A facility where the the DP photon detectors will be coated, tested, and stored.
ctsf.defLaTeX: A facility where the the \gls{dp} photon detectors will be coated, tested, and stored

cuc.defHTML: The utility cavern at the 4850L of SURF located between the two detector caverns. It contains utilities such as central cryogenics and other systems, and the underground data center and control room.
cuc.defLaTeX: The utility cavern at the 4850L of \gls{surf} located between the two detector caverns. It contains utilities such as central cryogenics and other systems, and the underground data center and control room

cvn.defHTML: An algorithm for identifying neutrino interactions based on their topology and without the need for detailed reconstruction algorithms.
cvn.defLaTeX: An algorithm for identifying neutrino interactions based on their topology and without the need for detailed reconstruction algorithms

daphne.defHTML: Detector electronics for Acquiring PHotons from NEutrinos is a custom-developed warm front-end waveform digitizing electronics module derived from the readout system developed at Fermilab for the Mu2e experiment.
daphne.defLaTeX: Detector electronics for Acquiring PHotons from NEutrinos is a custom-developed warm front-end waveform digitizing electronics module derived from the readout system developed at Fermilab for the Mu2e experiment

daq.defHTML: The data acquisition system accepts data from the detector FE electronics, buffers the data, performs a trigger decision, builds events from the selected data and delivers the result to the offline secondary DAQ buffer.
daq.defLaTeX: The data acquisition system  accepts data from the detector \gls{fe} electronics, buffers  the data, performs a \gls{trigdecision}, builds events from the selected  data and delivers the result to the offline \gls{diskbuffer}

daqbes.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that is generally toward its output end. It is responsible for accepting and executing trigger commands and marshaling the data they address to output storage buffers.
daqbes.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that is generally toward its output end.  It is responsible for accepting and executing trigger commands and marshaling the data they address to output storage buffers

daqbuf.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts full data stream from the corresponding detector unit and retains it sufficiently long for it to be available to produce a data fragment.
daqbuf.defLaTeX: The portion  of the \gls{daqfrag} that accepts full data stream from the  corresponding \gls{detunit} and retains it sufficiently long for it  to be available to produce a \gls{datafrag}

daqccm.defHTML: A system for controlling, configuring and monitoring other systems in particular those that make up the DAQ where the CCM encompasses RC.
daqccm.defLaTeX: A system for controlling, configuring and monitoring other systems in particular those that make up the \gls{daq} where the CCM encompasses \gls{rc}
daqccm.term: DAQ control, configuration and monitoring subsystem

daqdfo.defHTML: The process by which trigger commands are executed in parallel and asynchronous manner by the back-end output subsystem of the DAQ.
daqdfo.defLaTeX: The process by which trigger commands are executed in parallel and asynchronous manner by the back-end output subsystem of the \gls{daq}

daqdispre.defHTML: As used in the context of the IPC, a system that provides mechanisms for a node on a communication network to learn of the existence of peers and their identity (discovery) as well as determine if they are currently operational or have become unresponsive (presence).
daqdispre.defLaTeX: As used in the context of the \gls{ipc}, a system that provides mechanisms for a node on a communication network to learn of the existence of peers and their identity (discovery) as well as determine if they are currently operational or have become unresponsive (presence)

daqdr.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the FER, emits trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and forwards the full data stream to the DAQ primary buffer.
daqdr.defLaTeX: The portion of the  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the \gls{daqfer}, emits  trigger candidates produced from the input trigger primitives, and  forwards the full data stream to the \gls{daqbuf}

daqds.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ front-end fragment that accepts trigger commands and returns the corresponding data fragment. Not to be confused with data selection.
daqds.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daqfrag}  that accepts \glspl{trigcommand} and returns the corresponding  \gls{datafrag}.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqdsn}

daqdsn.defHTML: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the DAQ from the content of the detector data itself. Not to be confused with data selector.
daqdsn.defLaTeX: The process of forming a trigger decision for selecting a subset of detector data for output by the \gls{daq} from the content of the detector data itself.  Not to be confused with \gls{daqds}

daqdss.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream. The majority subset of the DAQ TS.
daqdss.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision based on a portion of the input data stream.  The majority subset of the \gls{daqtrs}

daqeti.defHTML: Interface between MTLs and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information.
daqeti.defLaTeX: Interface between \glspl{mtl} and external source and sinks of relevant trigger information

daqfer.defHTML: The portion of a DAQ front-end fragment that accepts data from the detector electronics and provides it to the DAQ FEC.
daqfer.defLaTeX: The portion of a  \gls{daqfrag} that accepts data from the detector electronics and  provides it to the \gls{fec}

daqfrag.defHTML: The portion of one DAQ partition relating to a single DAQ FEC and corresponding to an integral number of detector units. See also data fragment.
daqfrag.defLaTeX: The portion of one  \gls{daqpart} relating to a single \gls{fec} and corresponding to an  integral number of \glspl{detunit}.  See also \gls{datafrag}

daqoob.defHTML: This component is responsible for dispatching a SNB dump command to all FERs in the detector module.
daqoob.defLaTeX: This component is responsible for dispatching a \gls{snb} dump  command to all \glspl{daqfer} in the \gls{detmodule}

daqpart.defHTML: A cohesive and coherent collection of DAQ hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of DAQ front-end fragments. Multiple DAQ partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently.
daqpart.defLaTeX: A cohesive and coherent collection of \gls{daq} hardware and software working together to trigger and read out some portion of one detector module; it consists of an integral number of \glspl{daqfrag}. Multiple \gls{daq} partitions may operate simultaneously, but each instance operates independently

daqros.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics.
daqros.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} for accepting and buffering data input from detector electronics

daqrou.defHTML: The first element in the data flow of the DAQ.
daqrou.defLaTeX: The first element in the data flow of the \gls{daq}

daqrun.defHTML: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and DAQ configuration are asserted to be unchanged. Multiple DAQ runs may occur simultaneously when multiple DAQ partitions are active. This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam ``runs'' that typically span many DAQ runs.
daqrun.defLaTeX: A period of time over which relevant data taking conditions and \gls{daq} configuration are asserted to be unchanged.  Multiple \gls{daq} runs may occur simultaneously when multiple \glspl{daqpart} are active.  This term should not be confused with DUNE experiment or beam ``runs'' that typically span many \gls{daq} runs

daqrunnum.defHTML: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a DAQ run.
daqrunnum.defLaTeX: A monotonically increasing count that uniquely and globally identifies a \gls{daqrun}

daqtrs.defHTML: The subsystem of the DAQ responsible for forming a trigger decision.
daqtrs.defLaTeX: The subsystem of the \gls{daq} responsible for forming a trigger decision

daqtss.defHTML: The portion of the DAQ that provides for timing and synchronization to various components.
daqtss.defLaTeX: The portion of the \gls{daq} that provides for timing and synchronization to various components

daqubi.defHTML: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream DAQ buffers to processes on the network.
daqubi.defLaTeX: The process which provides read-only access to data residing in the upstream \gls{daq} buffers to processes on the network

datafrag.defHTML: A block of data read out from a single DAQ front-end fragment thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a trigger command.
datafrag.defLaTeX: A block of data read out from a single \gls{daqfrag} thatspan a contiguous period of time as requested by a \gls{trigcommand}

dayabay.defHTML: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle $\Theta_{13}$ using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants.
dayabay.defLaTeX: a neutrino-oscillation experiment in Daya Bay, China, designed to measure the mixing angle $\Theta_{13}$  using antineutrinos produced by the reactors of the Daya Bay and Ling Ao nuclear power plants

dcdb.defHTML: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each detector module.
dcdb.defLaTeX: Database used by DUNE to track the history and testing of all parts of each \gls{detmodule}

ddss.defHTML: The system used to manage key aspects of detector safety.
ddss.defLaTeX: The system used to manage key aspects of detector safety

detmodule.defHTML: The entire DUNE far detector is segmented into four modules, each with a nominal \SI{10}{\kton} fiducial mass.
detmodule.defLaTeX: The entire DUNE far detector is  segmented into four modules, each with a nominal \SI{10}{\kton}  fiducial mass

detunit.defHTML: Aportion of a detector module may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts. For example the SP TPCis made up of APA units (and other elements).
detunit.defLaTeX: Aportion of a \gls{detmodule} may be further partitioned into a number of similar parts.   For example the \gls{sp} \gls{tpc}is made up of \gls{apa}  units (and other elements)

dirac.defHTML: Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many HEP experiments.
dirac.defLaTeX: Computing workflow management designed for LHCb and now used by many HEP experiments

dis.defHTML: Refers to the interaction of an elementary charged particle with a nucleus in an energy range where the interaction can be modeled as taking place with individual nucleons.
dis.defLaTeX: Refers to the  interaction of an elementary charged particle with a nucleus in an  energy range where the interaction can be modeled as taking place with  individual nucleons

diskbuffer.defHTML: A secondary DAQ buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as selected by a trigger command. This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline.
diskbuffer.defLaTeX: A secondary  \gls{daq} buffer holds a small subset of the full rate as  selected by a \gls{trigcommand}.  This buffer also marks the interface with the DUNE Offline

dm.defHTML: The term given to the unknown matter or force that explains measurements of galaxy motion that are otherwise inconsistent with the amount of mass associated with the observed amount of photon production}.
dm.defLaTeX: The term given to the unknown  matter or force that explains measurements of galaxy motion  that are otherwise inconsistent with the amount of mass associated  with the observed amount of photon production}

dnl.defHTML: A commonly used measure of performance in ADCs. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one LSB.
dnl.defLaTeX: A commonly used measure of performance in \glspl{adc}. The DNL error is defined as the difference between an actual step width and the ideal value of one \gls{lsb}

docdb.defHTML: A computerized document management system developed and supported at Fermilab in which virtually all LBNF and most DUNE documents are managed.
docdb.defLaTeX: A computerized document management system developed and supported at \gls{fnal} in which virtually all LBNF and most DUNE documents are managed

doecd.defHTML: The U.S. DOE's Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD).
doecd.defLaTeX: The U.S. DOE's Order 413.3B outlines a series of staged project approvals, each of which is referred to as a critical decision (CD)

doma.defHTML: data organization, management, and access efforts through theHEP Software Foundation.
doma.defLaTeX: data organization, management, and access efforts through theHEP Software Foundation

dp.defHTML: Distinguishes one of the DUNE far detector technologies by the fact that it operates using argon in both gas and liquid phases.
dp.defLaTeX: Distinguishes one of the DUNE far detector technologies by the fact that it operates using argon in both gas and liquid phases

dqm.defHTML: Analysis of the raw data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be performed in real time, within the DAQ system, or in later stages of processing, using disk files as input.
dqm.defLaTeX: Analysis of the raw  data to monitor the integrity of the data and the performance of the  detectors and their electronics. This type of monitoring may be  performed in real time, within the \gls{daq} system, or in later  stages of processing, using disk files as input

The resolution of an \gls{adc} is specified by the number of bits used to represent the analog value, in principle giving 2N signal levels for an N-bit signal. However, all real \gls{adc} circuits introduce noise and distortion. ENOB specifies the resolution of an ideal \gls{adc} circuit that would have the same resolution as the circuit under consideration

sma.defLaTeX: Connector interface for coaxial cableswith a screw-type coupling mechanism

sndr.defHTML: Also known as SINAD. Ratio of the RMS signal amplitude to the mean value of the root-sum-square of all other spectral components, including harmonics, but excluding DC levels. It is a good indication of the overall dynamic performance of an ADC because it includes all components which make up noise and distortion.
sndr.defLaTeX: Also known as SINAD. Ratio of the \gls{rms} signal amplitude to the mean value of the root-sum-square of all other spectral components, including harmonics, but excluding \gls{dc} levels. It is a good indication of the overall dynamic performance of an \gls{adc} because it includes all components which make up noise and distortion
sndr.term: signal to noise and distortion ratio

snews.defLaTeX: A global  supernova neutrino burst trigger formed by a coincidence of \gls{snb}  triggers collected from participating experiments

sno.defLaTeX: The Sudbury Neutrino Observatory was a detector built 6800 feet under ground, in INCO's Creighton mine near Sudbury, Ontario, Canada. SNO was a heavy-water Cherenkov detector designed to detect neutrinos produced by fusion reactions in the sun

sp.defHTML: Distinguishes one of the DUNE far detector technologies by the fact that it operates using argon in its liquid phase only.

spice.defHTML: SPICE(``Simulation Program with Integrated Circuit Emphasis'') is a general-purpose,open-source analog electronic circuit simulator. It is a program used in integratedcircuit and board-level design to check the integrity of circuit designs and topredict circuit behavior.
spice.defLaTeX: SPICE(``Simulation Program with Integrated Circuit Emphasis'') is a general-purpose,open-source analog electronic circuit simulator. It is a program used in integratedcircuit and board-level design to check the integrity of circuit designs and topredict circuit behavior

ssc.defHTML: The Superconducting Super Collider was to be a huge underground ring complex beneath the area near Waxahachie, Texas, USA, that would have been the world’s most energetic particle accelerator. It was begun in 1990, but canceled by the U.S. Congress in 1993 (scientificamerican.com Oct 2013).
ssc.defLaTeX: The Superconducting Super Collider was to be a huge underground ring complex beneath the area near Waxahachie, Texas, USA, that would have been the world’s most energetic particle accelerator. It was begun in 1990, but canceled by the U.S. Congress in 1993 (scientificamerican.com Oct 2013)

susy.defLaTeX: Theoretical symmetry between a fermion and a boson

tb.defLaTeX: The DUNE organization responsible for  evaluating technical decisions

tc.defLaTeX: The DUNE organization responsible for overall integrationof the detector elements and successful execution of the detectorconstruction project; areas of responsibility includegeneral project oversight, systems engineering, \gls{qa} and safety

tpc.defHTML: A type of particle detector that uses an \efield together with a sensitive volume of gas or liquid, e.g., LAr, to perform a \threed reconstruction of a particle trajectory or interaction. The activity is recorded by digitizing the waveforms of current induced on the anode as the distribution of ionization charge passes by or is collected on the electrode.
tpc.defLaTeX: A type of particle detector that uses an \efield together with a sensitive volume of gas or liquid, e.g., \gls{lar}, to perform a \threed reconstruction of a particle trajectory or interaction. The activity is recorded by digitizing the waveforms of current  induced on the anode as the distribution of ionization charge passes by  or is collected on the electrode

tpm.defLaTeX: A message flowing  up the trigger hierarchy from local to global context.  Also see \gls{tcm}

trigcandidate.defLaTeX: Summary information derived  from the full data stream and representing a contribution toward  forming a \gls{trigdecision}

trigcommand.defLaTeX: Information derived from  one or more \glspl{trigcandidate}  that directs elements of the  \gls{detmodule} to read out a portion of the data stream

trigprimitive.defLaTeX: Information derived by  the \gls{daq} \gls{fe} hardware that describes a region of space (e.g.,  one or several neighboring channels) and time (e.g., a contiguous set  of \gls{adc} sample ticks) associated with some activity

ua1.defHTML: UA1 (Underground Area 1) was a particle detector at CERN's Super Proton Synchrotron (SPS). It ran from 1981 until 1990, when the SPS was used as a proton-antiproton collider, searching for traces of W and Z particles in collisions. (CERN) The UA1 dipole magnet was reused in the NOMAD experiment and currently provides the magnetic field for the T2K ND280 detector.
ua1.defLaTeX: UA1 (Underground Area 1) was a particle detector at \gls{cern}'s  Super Proton Synchrotron (SPS). It ran from 1981 until 1990, when the SPS was used as a proton-antiproton collider, searching for traces of W and Z particles in collisions. (CERN) The UA1 dipole magnet was reused in the NOMAD experiment and currently provides the magnetic field for the \gls{t2k} ND280 detector

uart.defHTML: A universalasynchronous receiver-transmitter is a computer hardware device for asynchronousserial communication in which the data format and transmission speeds are configurable.
uart.defLaTeX: A universalasynchronous receiver-transmitter is a computer hardware device for asynchronousserial communication in which the data format and transmission speeds are configurable

udp.defLaTeX: A simple,  connectionless Internet protocol that supports data integrity  checksums, requires no handshaking, and does not guarantee packet delivery

unicamp.defHTML: University of Campinas, Sao Paulo, Brazil.
unicamp.defLaTeX: University of Campinas, Sao Paulo, Brazil

wbs.defLaTeX: An organizational  project management tool by which the tasks to be performed are  partitioned in a hierarchical manner

wr.defLaTeX: A component of the timing system that forwards clock signal and time-of-day reference data to the master timing unit

zs.defLaTeX: Used to delete some portion of a  data stream that does not significantly deviate from zero or  intrinsic noise levels.  It may be applied at different granularity from per-channel to per  \gls{detunit}
